content.rendered:
Tokeny Insights August 2019

Hello

Welcome to this month‘s edition of Tokeny Insights and trading tips. This post is mainly aimed at those who have basic knowledge of the trading industry. If you are yet to gain this important information, you may wish to enroll on this forex trading course. If you already have a Forex broker trading company and are needing some help with your overall business from a customer standpoint, you can look at helpful Forex CRM services, as well as reading on.

There‘s a notion that tokenization will bring a greater amount of investment opportunities to a wider group of investors. This is yet to come to fruition for two different reasons. Firstly, there has been a lack of marketplaces and liquidity providers for tokenized securities. Secondly, distributors have had a limited amount of credible asset-backed tokens to list. Herein lies what many are calling the chicken and egg problem. It creates challenges, but also opportunities for the early adopters.

This month we saw the first neobanks combine digital banking services with online marketplaces. Revolut, the mobile bank with 4.5 million customers, added stock trading to its platform, allowing users to buy amazon shares uk, or invest in any other company they like the look of. This in turn, has even led to traditional banks such as JP Morgan to respond with their own digital investment services to retain their customers and perhaps even attract some new customers too. The expanding choice of online stock trading services will be welcome to those who are keen on investing money in the stock market. The likes of Robinhood and N26 raised under $1bn in July, capital that will enable them to develop similar services to Revolut and heavily expand their product lines. The rise of neobanks is not restricted to the US and Europe. Kyash have developed an offering that is set to disrupt traditional banking services in Japan, and raised $14 million last month.

One reason for the rise of these neobanks is the increase in millennial wealth. In the US alone, it‘s been reported that $30 trillion is about to change hands from the baby boomers to the millennial generation (CNBC). As more and more digitally savvy millennials accrue disposable wealth, the demand and expectations for digital investment opportunities will undoubtedly increase. At the moment neobanks have only scratched the surface with offering investment opportunities to its users, but what will happen once they understand they can use a complete turnkey blockchain infrastructure? How long will it take for them to adopt tokenization projects? I would be very intrigued to get your thoughts.

Thank you for reading and speak soon. Any thoughts or questions then please reply to this email.

Best wishes,
Luc Falempin
Tokeny CEO

MARKET SPOTLIGHT

Significant news and insights selected by our team of security token experts

Robinhood Raises Valuation to $7.6 billion, Receives $323 million in Funding

No-fee stock-trading startup Robinhood has received $323 million investment money in its newest funding round. This brings the startup‘s valuation to $7.6 billion.

The Block

Read more

Revolut’s Adding Stock Trading to its App to get Millennials Investing

The neobank’s 4.5 million customers will now be able to buy stocks from the New York Exchange and NASDAQ straight from the app.

Wired

Read more

Wisp Artificial Intelligence Assistant Developer Launches its Share Offering

Upstart tech-oriented real estate developer, Neovate, has launched its offering. It is poised to be the first to integrate a seamless conversational AI voice assistant, Wisp, into the fabric of buildings.

Wisp

Read more

Blockchain Based Crowdfunding Platform Smartlands has Big Plans

Smartlands, a blockchain-based crowdfunding platform, says it will tokenize “real-world assets“ for a total of $1 billion by the end of 2023.

Crowdfund Insider

Read more

First Completed Real Estate Transaction via Blockchain in Luxembourg

Property Token S.A., has successfully launched the first issuance of a Luxembourg real estate token powered by Tokeny Solutions.

Securities.io

Read more

How to Sell a Stake in your Home via the Ethereum Blockchain

SmartRE offers an Ethereum-based alternative to home equity loans and reverse mortgages. And it‘s catching fire in California‘s real-estate market.

Decrypt

Read more

COMPLIANCE IN FOCUS

Compliance and regulatory news curated by our team of industry insiders

UK Regulator Issues Relaxed Guidance on Crypto

After promising to deliver clarification on crypto assets last year, the UK financial watchdog, the FCA, has published an updated report on the crypto market in the country.

The Block

Read more

Galaxy Digital Granted Broker-Dealer License by FINRA

Galaxy Digital Holdings Ltd announced that it had been granted a broker-dealer license by independent United States securities regulator, FINRA.

Cryptoglobe

Read more

Why Have Regulators Reacted so Strongly to Libra by Facebook?

It didn’t take long. Within hours of Libra being announced the global regulatory system had plenty of opinions on what it meant and how it needed to be governed.

11 FS

Read more

The Tokenization of Securities is Happening Right now and No One is Noticing

On July 10, the SEC officially cleared blockchain startup Blockstack to hold the first regulated security token offering under Reg A+ crowdfunding rules.

Venturebeat

Read more

Subscribe to the newsletter:

Subscribe
